trigger: Although NAC reduced nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) activation in EC as measured by gel-shift assays using an oligonucleotide probe corresponding to the consensus NF-kappa B binding sites of the <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene ( VCAM-NF-kappa B ) , the antioxidant had no appreciable effect when an oligomer corresponding to the consensus NF-kappa B binding site of the <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene ( <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - NF-kappa B ) was used .

Although NAC reduced nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) activation in EC as measured by gel-shift assays using an oligonucleotide probe corresponding to the consensus NF-kappa B binding sites of the VCAM-1 gene ( VCAM-NF-kappa B ) , the antioxidant had no appreciable effect when an oligomer corresponding to the consensus NF-kappa B binding site of the E-selectin gene ( E-selectin - NF-kappa B ) was used .
Because NF-kappa B has been reported to be redox sensitive , we studied the effects of NAC on the EC redox environment .
Because NF-kappa B has been reported to be redox sensitive , we studied the effects of NAC on the EC redox environment .
NAC caused an expected dramatic increase in the reduced glutathione ( GSH ) levels in EC .
NAC caused an expected dramatic increase in the reduced glutathione ( GSH ) levels in EC .

In vitro studies demonstrated that whereas the binding affinity of NF-kappa B to the VCAM-NF-kappa B oligomer peaked at a GSH-to-oxidized glutathione ( GSSG ) ratio of approximately 200 and decreased at higher ratios , the binding to the <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - NF-kappa B oligomer appeared relatively unaffected even at ratios > 400 , i.e . , those achieved in EC treated with 40 mM NAC .

In vitro studies demonstrated that whereas the binding affinity of NF-kappa B to the VCAM-NF-kappa B oligomer peaked at a GSH-to-oxidized glutathione ( GSSG ) ratio of approximately 200 and decreased at higher ratios , the binding to the E-selectin - NF-kappa B oligomer appeared relatively unaffected even at ratios > 400 , i.e . , those achieved in EC treated with 40 mM NAC .

These results suggest that NF-kappa B binding to its consensus sequences in the <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene exhibits marked differences in redox sensitivity , allowing for differential gene expression regulated by the same transcription factor .
